The super and smart grids for the layperson
The super and smart grids for the layperson

Since two decades, the electrical grid has changed a lot. Renewable energy sources are nowadays used massively, sometimes exceeding conventional fossil power plants. Therefore, the energy flows have changed dramatically and new structures have started to emerge. These are the supergrids and the smart grids. The supergrids accommodate the transmission of bulk energy over long distances. Smart grids deal with energy management on the demand (distribution level) side. Truly, the boundaries are not so sharp, as a universal definition of smart grid has not been accepted yet.The short course will present the drivers beyond this change (reduction of carbon emission, volatile prices of fossil fuels, better management of transmission systems), the solutions adopted so far (e.g. HVDC links and grids, supernodes, storage systems, synchronous reactive power compensation systems, active network management, automatic voltage control, smart metering) and the consequences of these changes observed so far (e.g. bidirectional power flows, rebalancing of geographical energy flows, impact of large renewable plants on failure events).The course is not meant for electrical engineers, but for laypersons i.e. somebody with a minimum background on electricity. It aims at stimulating interest towards a technology that is deemed to be an old one, but that is indeed undergoing a revolution.

PLUS factorization of matrices is a new framework for matrix factorization. The series of publications present the solutions to the problem of lossless coding with linear transforms and the problem of shear factorization for fast geometric transforms of volumetric data. The lossless implementation of linear transforms has been accepted inthe international standard for image coding, JPEG 2000.Based on the reversible transformation theory, further research has been done forinfinity-norm rotation transform, which is a new class of nonlinear transforms, asignificant extension of orthogonal linear transforms.Reversible resampling of signals was previously considered to be impossible except some extremely special cases because of strong attenuation of high frequencies after interpolation, but I have proved with PLUS factorization that signal resampling using polynomial interpolation can be reversible even for integer signals. This is a significant correction to the previous theory.This course would be given for the background, the theory and the related applications, mainly about the research we have done so far.

Fields of human-robot interaction and human-centreddesign became extremely important and knowledge on how to design and use robots innon-industrial human environments is essential for the 21 st century professionals.During this course, the students will learn key principles of designing, building andcontrolling of robots for humans. 本课程为计算机科学与技术专业、网络工程专业的专业课（必修）。计算机组成原理是计算机专业本科学生的主干课程，课程的综合性强、知识面广、比较抽象、学习难度大，因此本门课程的实验课显得尤其重要。通过本实验课程的开设使学生较深刻地了解计算机的组成与结构、计算机的工作原理。此外，本实验过程中要用到很多芯片，线路连接也较复杂，通过本门课的实验给以后的硬件实验课打下良好的基础。要求学生用TDN-CM++实验系统独立完成下面五个实验：运算器组成实验（包括算术逻辑运算实验、进位控制实验、移位运算实验）、静态随机存储器实验、总线控制实验、微控制器实验、基本模型机设计与实现实验。

本课程是面向计算机学院学生的选修课程，课程以专题的形式讲授当今计算机应用领域的前沿课题，包括各种新技术、新方法、新理论等；内容涵盖软件工程、图形图像技术、嵌入式系统、实时软件、空中交通管理、数据通信等方向。本课程的开设有助于学生理论联系实际、拓展知识面。

散数学课程是计算机科学课程体系的重要组成部分。主要向学生传授计算机科学的数学基础。这门计算机专业的必修课程有助于学生对数学推导的阅读、理解和构建数学推理。课程主要包括: 集合的概念、性质和运算；数理逻辑：命题逻辑、谓词逻辑及推理规则；关系及其基本性质、等价关系、偏序关系、全序关系、良序关系；函数的定义与性质；代数系统的基本理论, 半群、群、环和域及格与布尔代数；图论学科的基本概念及性质、欧拉图、哈密尔顿图、平面图、树及其性质。

嵌入式系统设计是一门综合性的课程，是软件、硬件设计的完美结合，涉及到了电子、计算机、自动控制等诸多专业知识，综合性强，包括微机原理、单片机设计、操作系统等课程内容。重点基于ARM芯片，并注重嵌入式Linux和WinCE两个操作系统下的软件教学和实践。本课程采用软硬件结合的方式介绍嵌入式系统设计，以帮助有志于从事嵌入式系统设计的学生和工程技术人员，学习了解嵌入式技术研发的基本概念、方法和知识，获得一些嵌入式开发设计实践经验，提高嵌入式系统的软硬件综合设计能力。
通过人工智能导论的学习，了解人工智能的基本理论和基本方法，掌握人工智能的经典思想，使学生树立人工智能系统的思想和增强人工智能的应用。
